content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 4.187 - Executive order no. 187: advancing the governor's excelsior award program as a continuing cooperative effort between excelsior award, inc. and the state of new york

State Regulations
WHEREAS, the adoption of quality improvement principles has
demonstrated benefits for employees, employers and customers of all types of
public and private organizations in all sectors, including business, education, health care, not-for-profit organizations, organized labor and
government; WHEREAS, the State of New York seeks to advance the
understanding and adoption of quality improvement principles by all
organizations in New York; WHEREAS, the Governor's Excelsior Award Program was
established in 1991 by the Statewide Labor-Management Committee to develop and
enhance economic and workforce development efforts within various types of
organizations by fostering a stronger environment for quality in New York

State; WHEREAS, the Excelsior Executive Committee, comprised of
volunteers from all sectors and types of organizations, has contributed
critical support and expertise that has allowed the Excelsior Award Program to
succeed; WHEREAS, the Excelsior Award Program has proved to be a
low-cost economic development tool that fosters a conversion to high
performance work organizations; WHEREAS, the interest in quality has expanded, and a
flexible structure is needed to meet the changing needs of a broader range of
organizations; WHEREAS, the State of New York and Excelsior Award, Inc., a
not-for-profit corporation formed by volunteers from the State's private
sector, are mutually desirous of advancing the State's Excelsior Award
initiative; WHEREAS, Excelsior Award, Inc., in addition to providing
ongoing financial and administrative support for the Excelsior Award Program, has agreed to collaborate with the State of New York to assist in advancing the

State's Excelsior Award initiative; WHEREAS, the collaboration will be evidenced, among other
ways, by an expanded Board of Directors of Excelsior Award, Inc., composed of
fifteen members chosen by the current Board of Directors of Excelsior Award, Inc., with recommendations for some seats by the Governor and the

Legislature; NOW, THEREFORE, I, MARIO M. CUOMO, Governor of the State of

New York, by virtue of the authority vested in me by the Constitution and Laws
of the State of New York, do hereby order as follows: I. Cooperation with Excelsior Award, Inc. A. The State of New York shall encourage and
cooperate with Excelsior Award, Inc. in its efforts to: 1. administer the overall Excelsior Award

Program, which includes: the Excelsior Award, a self assessment process designed to
recognize world-class role model organizations and to provide a framework
against which organizations can be measured; and the Quality Academy, a
structure that provides: broad public and private outreach through a Speakers

Bureau; ii. assistance and guidance for
organizations implementing quality management; research of quality issues; collaboration with existing programs and organizations to
broaden quality initiatives; encouragement of local quality networks statewide; and the
development of programs to meet the needs of organizations statewide, including
the Starter Guide program, a tool designed for organizations just beginning to
use quality strategies. 2. develop partnerships with organizations
within each economic sector to institute the concept of continuous improvement
and to increase the use of quality tools in organizations; and
3. develop and implement a strategic plan for
the overall program. B. The Board of Directors of Excelsior Award, Inc., in cooperation with the State
of New York, has agreed to enlarge its Board of Directors to fifteen members. The fifteen members will be appointed by the current Board of Directors of

Excelsior Award, Inc., working with the Excelsior Award Executive Committee. Of
the fifteen members, six shall be upon the nomination of the Governor, one upon
the nomination of the Temporary President of the Senate and one upon the
nomination of the Speaker of the Assembly. Of the members nominated by the

Governor, two shall be heads of State agencies advancing quality initiatives, two shall represent organized labor and two shall be at-large members. Board
membership will reflect all the sectors served by the Excelsior Award Program, including but not limited to business, education, health care, not-for-profit
organizations and organized labor, as well as organizations that support
quality initiatives. C. Excelsior

Award, Inc. has agreed to provide an annual report for the Governor and the

Legislature. II. Assistance of State Agencies

All departments, divisions, boards, offices, and public
corporations of the State are requested to cooperate with and provide
appropriate assistance to Excelsior Award, Inc. to enable it to fulfill its
purposes. Signed: Mario M. CuomoDated: September 26, 1994
[FN*] [Revoked by Executive Order No. 5 (Eliot Spitzer), infra.]
[Revoked by Executive Order No. 9 (David A. Paterson), infra.]
[Revoked by Executive Order No. 2 (Andrew M. Cuomo), infra.]
